Subseries IV.B. Publicity Director Jane Gilchrist Files

Jane Gilchrist's files document her work organizing or publicizing Sports Illustrated (SI) events. Specifically, Gilchrist's files document: her planning and publicizing of events related to SI's 20th and 25th anniversary, including researching the history of SI for background material; work done by SI to produced and distributed the official souvenir program for the 1984 Los Angeles Olympics; SI's 1986 poll on American's attitudes towards sports and athletes; publicity around announcements of the Sportsman and Sportswoman of the Year; publicity regarding the swimsuit covers; and Time Inc.'s trial run working on the magazine Women's Sports & Fitness (WSF). The majority of records are correspondence, magazine issues, press releases, press conference notes and invites, press kits, and photographic material of events.

Items of interest include a videotape of an interview with editor Julie Campbell on the evolution of the swimsuit cover for a news segment on swimwear and a letter in WSF Media Lists from Billie Jean King containing her comments on the business relationship between SI and WSF.
Unreformatted audiovisual material in the collection is not accessible.

Jane Gilchrist joined Time Inc. as an Sports Illustrated (SI) production assistant in 1955. She is first listed in the Department Heads Lists in 1976 as the Press Information Director. From 1979 to 1987, she holds the title of Publicity Director, taking over part of Keith Morris's position. A September 1972 article from the staff newsletter FYI announced her promotion to promotion manager of Time-Life Video after serving five years at the SI direct mail manager although her files indicate she returned to SI soon after.
Time Inc. Reference Files, MS 3009-RG 3, New-York Historical Society.
